[/rant]It's smaller than other places, but for the size of the crowd that night: ideal. The rickshaws were cute, the ambiance much like the old-school dive bars I've seen in Bali, and the bartenders friendly. I had a few cocktails - two people made them delicious (strong yet sweet), another guy used the cheap stuff that tasted like mouthwash without the minty freshness.If you get there early, you could save yourself a seat in the loungey zone upstairs and hang out while all the openers do their thing. We got there at 7:55 and 4 bands + a little over 3 hours later, we heard Zee Avi. The highlight of that night was Zee Avi's performance, then running into her in the restroom and chatting with her for a bit.

This place was great when they had club BLOW UP there. Minus the no AC thing. Gets REALLY HOT when people are dancing. But now that blow up is gone, not sure if there is anymore dancing there?The end.

I've been going here for years for all sorts of event. From rock and roll spelling bee to LOVELIKEFIRE to Ambulette....It's a very interesting setup too. Just explore a little. They have some decent drinks on tap and I think we even had sangria last time! there is a second floor to watch events/music from, so come early and get a good seat. Also, if you hate society, and pay to see an indie band, but then hate being trendy so you don't' want to WATCH the indie band you just paid for, then there is foosball upstairs. You can play it while wearing an ironic shirt. You know who you are.

Went to see Garotas Suecas at the Rickshaw last night. I've been waiting for this band since last year after a cancelled show due to visas being denied. Finally last night, I got to see 'em funky fresh in the flesh! To be brutally honest though, I didn't really care too much for the opening acts. The first guy sat there playing his acoustic guitar damn near had me ready to swallow razor blades. The next band, Lumerians, were pretty dope but I wasn't in the mood to hear anybody but Garotas Suecas, since that's who I came to see. They brought the fuzzy spaced out funk straight from Sao Paulo son! I met the guitarist who was real cool and he gave me the set-list (I'm such a nerd). Rickshaw's a dope venue coz it's got a nice sized main floor and the extra-dope upstairs with a balcony that has a perfect view of the stage, if you don't feel like punching out the next idiot who steps in front of you after you've been posted up front waiting for the band you been wanting to see. Real talk! Why does that shit always happen though.Big up to Chris the security guy for being a real genuine dude! I got nothin' but respect for security guys who hold it down without being douchey, nah mean? Chris is cool, and so is the O.G. cat checkin' i.d.'s (sorry, I didn't get his name but if you go here, you know who I'm talkin' bout). Keep doing what y'all Rickshaw Stop!

Came here last week for the Non Stop Bhangra night. 20 dollar cover charge is a bit steep. The Bhangra instructor was quite effective but the lesson was really brief. It was only about 30 minutes and only the very basic moves were taught. At the end of the night I didn't feel like I have learned much about the dance at all. The music was fun. I have not been exposed to Indian Hip Hop much so I didn't know what to expect. The music was surprisingly easy to dance to. The dance floor was really stuffy especially when after it got really crowded later the night. The water dispenser was a life saver.
Had the best New Years here!Saw Glassy Candy & Desire perform. Was covering press for the show. Was a little surprised it was sold out. It was AMAZING! Great vibe, fun people.

I love the set up.  The crowd is hit-or-miss and when it's a miss, it really blows.  Sometimes I feel like I'm swimming in a sea of juveniles and it's kind of awkward.  They play great music and bring through some decent performers.  I haven't had the best experience with the bartenders here and that gets them 2 stars.  I've seen bartenders act very disrespectful towards customers here by yelling and giving serious attitude.  I've never witnessed bartenders act so rudely at any other venue or bar, and I'm a seasoned bar hopper so I know these things!

I loveee to dance and theres always good music! The crowd isnt always the best! And I have been a witness to the ROUGH security carrying people out. SCARY! Although the crowd isnt always the best I feel like you should go with the mind set of having fun even if im sober and being annoyed by drunkies I just go with the flow! I'm there to have fun not waste my time getting upset over the stupid idiot trying to dry hump me for the 5th time! :D If you like good remixes and can keep up I recomend you come out!

Super fun place to see a show! Like the fact that they have a coat check- always a plus. Affordable drinks, fun crowd! Definitely want to check out the other events here! Best part, affordable ticket prices for broke ppl like me!

I had the worst New Years Eve of my life because of this venue. My completely sober 125 pound boyfriend was standing to the side waiting for Glass Candy to go on while me friend and I were chatting with each other. We each payed about 45 bucks each, a heafty amount for a venue like the Rickshaw Stop, just to see the band play, then leave and go to friend's parties.Some guy rudely bumps my boyfriend to move, despite the amount of space around him that the guy could walk through easily. Then the guy tells him to walk outside with him because he was a sercurity guy. My boyfriend refused at first because they guy was going to kick him out then agreed to sort out what was going on. They go outside and the guy walks away. My boyfriend walks back in confused then the guy picks him up and forcibly carries him outside (RE-bruising an old rib injury my boyfriend had last year). This all happens AT MIDNIGHT.I'm demanding to see the manager and demanding for my money back. What could a 125 pound, well behaved man do to get him kicked out? Standing still isn't grounds to kick someone out. He wasn't drunk (like everyone else), he wasn't high (everyone else was) and he definitely wasn't harrassing people. All he did was refuse to move when someone was rudely pushing him instead of simply tapping him like everyone else does at a show.  The "manager" caves after listening to me complain about how his worker is bullying my boyfriend who is clearly sober, no threat and the last person to pick a fight with. He even agreed that my boyfriend didn't look like a threat. The worker even LIED and said that he did tap him on the shoulder to make it sound like his actions were justifiable. We think he was pissed about something unrelated and just wanted to pick on someone smaller than him.Me and my boyfriend have been coming to this venue since we were teens (between 10-14 years). Between us, we have gone to hundreds of shows over the years without any drama and we have NEVER been kicked out of any venue.We are tempted to go back to the venue and tell them that they re-injured my boyfriend's rib. We are also seriously considering talking to the owners about this (we know people who know them). I feel like we spent 90 bucks between us just to have a shitty time at their venue.We used to love this place. It used to be awesome where you could watch indie bands play. This was pre-Blow Up club nights when it really was about listening to good music and not about getting wasted, watching girls do tons of coke in the bathroom and where the people who worked there didn't pick on the wrong people.

Solid 3 stars, through and through. For every great show- there's some damn 19 year old begging you to buy them a drink. For all the fun parties- someone pukes on your shoes. For every game of fooseball, there's some weird aggro displaced marina kid who wants to fight a girl. (That might be an experience specific to me. Not sure...) For every great bartender- there's... well, never mind. The bartenders are just great.This place is the definition of give and take. The perfect place for a 3 star evening.

Saw Rupa and the April Fishes, with conspiracy of venus/beards.  Acoustics were absolutely terrible.  No bass, no ability to turn up voice volume, etc.  All around me were terribly disappointed with the Rupa show because of that.  Rupa herself was disappointed too, asking frequently for volume changes, but to no avail.

WTF happened to Blow Up?Ok, so I'm an avid YELP user but I've never actually written a review. This is my first, I made an account JUST to review BLOW UP @ The Rickshaw Stop.I went this Friday with a few friends. Had a TERRIBLE time. We're all in our early twenties but I felt like I was at a high school dance. HALF of the people there were children. Wasted, drugged, annoying, rude, obnoxious high schoolers. How do these kids get in?!It was Blow Up's "100th Anniversary" or something. It started off with some HORRIBLE 'performance' by two rapping lesbians. They were terrible. Despite the boos, they finished their act.I can't count the number of times I was pushed, shoved, and ran into without acknowledgment. At one point my friend and I were dance-attacked by some savage teenage girl on E. I had to push this bitch off of me numerous times!! Gays, forget it. I've been here about a dozen times and have never met any nice gays worth knowing. Oh, and I can never tell who's straight and who's hipster. HIPSTERS. Oh god! Don't get me started. So many weird, wanna-be indie hipster kids. So many v-necks, lense-less thick framed glasses, and skinny jeans, I wanted to kill myself.Also, if you DO happen to be underage and drinking, watch out. The bouncers here are ROUGH. I witnessed one of the male bouncers SCREAMING in this girls face after catching her drinking without a wrist band. He was yelling at the top of his lungs and screaming profanities for her to get out. And then a long brown-hair female worker there (bartender? female bouncer?) GRABS THIS GIRL BY THE THROAT and pushes her to get out. I couldn't believe what I was witnessing! Hardcore stuff.So yeah, in a nut shell. Don't waste your time on Blow Up. The ONLY saving grace of this event is the music... Not going to lie, its the only reason I lasted longer than an hour... Love the tunes! Oh, and if you go with some easy-going friends who love to dance.. you might be ok.
not my type of place but i had an ok experience at the Wallpaper record release show.

I've been to Rickshaw Stop quite a few times. You really have to come into this place with the right mentality. You have to know that a.) You will sweat like no other. I'm talking, you better be wearing your good deoderant/antiperspirant. None of that crystal stuff. b.) You have to have your dancing shoes on. Read: flats, sneakers...NO heels. c.) You have to expect your clothes to smell like cigarettes. Although, there is a smoking area upstairs, the smoke makes its way downstairs. So why was I surprised that I left my rainjacket underneath the lit christmas tree downstairs to find that it completely stunk of cigarette smoke? d.) You have to expect to be somewhat sore the next day...that and maybe a combination of sore and hungover. PLUSES:-I have never been disappointed. I have been to Blow Up, Cockblock and Rebel Girl. All great nights. Great music. Interesting people.-$5 tequila sunrise. Bar upstairs and downstairs. Not sure what the variety is like upstairs. -Upstairs, there's plenty of space to lounge around or just stand next to the railing. Please don't jump off.-Great photo ops. -When you go to 18+ events, you can find yourself as one of very few people getting drinks. Not much of a wait. Awesome.-Ins and outs allow for some breathing roomMINUS:-Please do something about the floor in front of the bar. That area is slippery as all hell. There really should be someone mopping/drying that area down. -18+ events, watch out for hot messes EVERYWHERE. You can tolerate this more when you have had 2+ drinks in you. You'll (almost) forget that they have pacifiers and glow sticks...again, almost.All in all, I never hesitate to come here. :)

Came here on Friday for Blow Up and it was completely dead the entire time. Bouncers here are assholes. Some bitch working coat check pushed me out of no where and told me to leave. Really? Was that necessary? Crowd was awesome as always. I swear, ignore the other reviews, people are crazy nice here. The bartender was awesome though. Don't know his name but he was super nice and made sure we got home okay and everything. Thanks!

You'll either love this place or hate it, but I'll be fair and admit that it's a lot fun mainly because I come here for the music they play at Blow Up. True, lots of 18+ kids who party here probably attend the local art school wearing their most expensive & trendiest outfit that mom and pop financed but if you ease up a bit most of them are just looking to get to know others with the same interest. It's what some would call a 'hipster' scene, but who cares? That doesn't stop most people from partying in SJ's Motif or Suite 181 when I call it the 'ghetto' scene.Expect the young, fabulous, trendy, tattooed & pierced type here! If you don't like this type, then obviously don't come here to ruin everyone else's good time with your negativity and sniveling. What I love about partying here for Blow UP is they constantly have different artists & DJ's coming here to bring you some fresh indie & electronica beats to dance to  a la Steve Aoki, Dan Oh, Skeet Skeet, Designer Drugs, Micky Avalon, etc. Richie Panic & Jeffrey Paradise are the usual DJ suspects here.Once when I came here with friends during the summer it was so hot we literally left the place drenched in sweat. I know it wasn't the weather that evening, but rather it was caused by everyone's dancing and enjoying themselves.Definitely worth it imo. Don't forget to say "Hi!" to Ava Berlin, she is such a sweetie!

I came for the fifth year anniversary of nonstop bhangra. We pre ordered our tickets online and saved about $5 a person and paid $15 plus a minimal service fee. It wasn't that crowded at first but around 945 the crowd started arriving for the class. I recommend standing in front so you can watch all of the moves.  It's actually pretty hard and some people need to learn to wear more deodorant. As you know, bhangra requires lots of arms up in the air and I smelled lots of BO. EwieAll in all it was fun. It gets pretty hot inside  so stay near the fans. Drinks are relatively inexpensive. They had a pretty good sangria for $5.

LOVE THE RICKSHAW!!! My favorite night is the rebel girl, the music is always amazing! I have been going here since i moved to SF 2 years ago and it's still one of my favorite places to dance!! It can be so hard to find a place that plays good indie music that i never hear any where else! (CSS, le tigre, crystal castles, yeah yeah yeahs, basement jaxx, etc) Breath of fresh air!!The Big Ole is also a rickshaw staple, PINT size vodka redbull. I don't have to tell you that more than one of those can be dangerous!!They also have a projector screen that they play videos on. It sits up on the stage, which you can dance on right by the DJ.The upstairs is cool as well. They have couches and a balcony area that looks over the dance floor that's nice to sit at when you need a dance break. Free foosball table, coat check and another bar as well. The smoke room is in the back and so if its damn cold out or crowded by the door, you can just smoke upstairs. There is a cover, but when i plan to go to the rickshaw i always spend the entire night here anyway.

This is my new favorite club. I love the vibe. People are nice and chill and the way they have it set up is pretty cool. After a while it gets pretty damn hot and stuffy but you're having so much fun you don't even care. The dj's are usually pretty good. I mostly go for the live performances which are always pretty interesting. Can't wait to go back!!

This place gets you hot & bothered in the BEST way possible! The girls here are young & wreckless (probably intoxicated too), the guys are assholes (or fresh princes like yours truly B) ). The dance floor mayhem is at maximum most of the time. Glasses fog up here for a reason! This is the place to be on Blow Up nights!

After turning 18, the club scene in SanFrancisco really isn't all the great if your not 21. You could go to City Nights and feel like your back at a high school dance but if your at all into electronic music and just enjoy being around cool people with good vibes I would definitley recommend checking Blow Up out at the Rickshaw Stop. It was actually the first club I ever went to and I was not disappointed, the music is great with mixes bringing back the Jackson fives to Queen and Benny benassi. Not only that but the cover charge is only $15 for 18+ and $10 for 21+! The only downside is that after 11pm the line will go around the block so if your not trying to wait in the cold I would recommend coming a bit early and try not to wear too much makeup because you will sweat it off!

I've been here twice.  It has good sound for live shows, an intimate setting, and a cool little upstairs with various areas for seating.  I'll probably like this place even more when my cousin turns 18, so I can drink here and she can escort my drunk ass home.  A rum and coke costs $5.  The cover charge is reasonable for the quality of acts they bring to the stage.It got a little too hot at the last show I went to, but it was sold out, and any dancey crowded place is going to get sweaty.  Oh, and multiple drinks were spilled on me...  After leaving here my shoes were covered in filth.All things considered, I'd go back!

I went to Blow Up with some friends to celebrate my 21st birthday and had a blast! Loved the crowd, and loved the venue--they have a lounge and bar upstairs that was surprisingly empty. We only used the bar upstairs (there's one downstairs too) but were thoroughly impressed by the girls bartending. They weren't too chatty, but the drinks were well-made and the girls were generous. The only issue I have with this place is that the music felt very repetitive: a friend described himself as "feeling as though [he] were listening to 20 minutes of one track, then 3 minutes of another track, and then 20 more minutes of the first track." The Tenderlions were playing, and it was a joy to watch them, but listening got old quickly. I'll probably come back again when someone else is playing and see what I think then.

first off somehow i end up here way to oftenhowever there is always a cool crowdhot girlshowever if you do not like to be hot and sweaty then do not, i repeat do not come to this place its hot as hell by 1130i however like to get hot sweaty and dance my ass off to good music i do like to arrive here after i have had large amounts of drinks  so i do not care anymore that i dance like an idiot

Definitely a place you go after pre-gaming it. Fun place to bring under 21 friends on fridays(blow up.) Good music, kinda young crowd. Don't ever get your bags/coats checked... they lost mine. But the manager let me in free the next two times and along with sixty dollars. : )

I've been coming to Blow up about twice a month for the last year or so. Knowing that I can come here on Fridays to blow off some steam and burn about a billion calories dancing and sweating for a few hours is the only thing that gets me through the week some times. It's $15 for 18+ and $10 for 21+, and well worth it at that.Jeffrey Paradise and Richie Panic are the resident DJ's and are a couple of the cities finest. Let me make one thing clear: Yes, this is an 18+ club, yes this means there are a fair amount of 18-20 year olds there, NO this does not ruin the club experience. This is a hip club. Meaning it's mainly a bunch of hip-kids decked out in American Apparel, Urban Outfitters, and/or various thrift/vintage shop clothing. It wouldn't matter if these kids were 16 or 30, they all act the same.If you're looking for a lounge to sip cocktails and relax, THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR YOU. If you're looking a wall to wall dance floor to 'blow up and get down' while getting absolutely soaked in your own (and everyone else's, mind you) sweat, this is your new mecca. And don't worry, if there's not enough room for you on the dance floor, there's a stage and piano you're more than welcome to conquer.

First went here in March 2007 to see the Spinto Band during Noisepop. Enjoyed it immensely because I loved the Spinto Band at the time! Apart from that, no outstanding or horrendous things to mention that immediately come to mind.** Recently went here this past Friday, September 4th to see The Twelves @ Loaded, supported by the Tenderlions with DJs Omar, Aaron and Sleazemore also spinning. SHIT WAS CRAZY! I kid you not! Once we were in around 10pm, as soon as people started getting inside, they were pumped and ready to get down, busting out moves randomly, psyched for the night ahead. As people got comfortable inside and had some drinkies, the party was jumping way before the Tenderlions and Twelves even came on! At the end, a bunch of people, myself included ahah, got up on stage and started grooving right along with the Twelves. Saying that it was just a good night would be an understatement.**Entertainment for the night apart from the music?- A somewhat attractive, almost Casey-Affleck look-alike, drunk French hipster who was not pretentious! but rather like I said, just very drunk later on. He did not trust his friends with hats very much and knew how to bust a move...sober.- London-native wannabe playa who was the French guy's friend although he was kind of funny to talk to.

a decent venue, although if asymmetrical haircuts make you sick , this is not the place to go I highly recommend BLOW UP , Jeffrey Paradise and Richie Panic are defiantly  some of San Francisco's finest, and make it worth going if you can tolerate younger crowds (i'd rather hear them spin at a 21+ venue)

What can I say?I love this place.The music is rockin', the people are good looking,But there are the occasional pretentious hipster assholes.But for the most part, people are nice.Other than that, the indoor smoking room is nice, just stuffy (obviously)Good electronic music!

Been to the Rickshaw twice now, keeping this short and sweet I guess I'd say it serves it's purpose as a decent live music venue. It's got a pretty large open area with a nice sized stage which allows you to listen to music. Which is it's purpose. So yea, I guess that's a solid 3 stars right, simply functioning as intended with no real stand out qualities?The drinks were mediocre, yet another 3 star designation, again nothing to really flip out about. They have coat check which is a plus. Many events are all ages or 18+ which generally I avoid like the plague, but I'm two for two on not being completely over run by any rabid groups of annoying kids.That's all I got. Boring huh? Not my fault they didn't inspire me to write anything else... If a show is going on here that you want to see then hell yea, Rickshaw works, I just wouldn't make a spontaneous jaunt here.

tried this place out the other night, doesn't seem big, but the staff was fairly friendly, i hear they do pack over capacity so that might suck if your not into packed venues. i do like this place and will definatly see shows here, the downsides, well. no stools at the bar, no coat check, roasting HOT inside, the smoking room smells like the fresh bouquet of homeless piss, upstairs while kinda cool, doesn't allow for full view of the stage. Pretty Good Sound though.

This is the first time I wish Yelp had negative stars.  Seriously.I went to the Rickshaw Stop several years ago and it was fine.  But I went last night to see the Lovemakers and it was most certainly NOT fine.  I felt sick when I got there, so spent most of the opening band sitting and trying to feel better so I could stay with my friends (I was the DD).  I was cuddling with my friend on the couch and had a hand over my eyes to sort of meditate and feel better when the bouncer came up and told me i'd have to leave if i wasn't "more energetic." i thought he was joking, but he came back 10 minutes later and said "i saw you napping, i'm going to ask you to leave.  the boss said that's not ok."  i replied incredulously "what?" and he said "did i stutter?"  i told him i wasn't feeling well and he said "that's too bad but i'm still going to kick you out if you don't start showing some more energy."WTF? since when is a club a pep rally?i suspect that they are running a shady deal where they pack their club past capacity, then pick out people to throw out for whatever reason so they can keep their money but not be *too* packed.don't worry, mr bouncer, i'll never darken your club with my floopiness again.

This is the worst club/venue in San Francisco by far.  A few of the employees aren't just rude--they're horrible human beings.  I saw the Lovemakers with a couple friends.  One of my friends got sick while she was there (and all she had to drink was a ginger ale in this hot and stuffy club). She sat down on the couch by the merch table to take a short break, but apparently 'the boss' didn't like this. One of the employees came by--a stocky bald guy with terrible facial hair--and said that she wasn't being "energetic enough."  My friend told him that she was getting sick and just resting for a second.  Rather than offering her some water, he said that he was going to "kick her out if she wasn't more energetic."  The douchiest part: she said "I'm sorry, what did you say?" and he did a poor Bender impression and said "did I stutter?"I hope that the next time he gets sick and needs medical assistance, he only gets quotes from John Hughes' movies.Read all the other 1-star reviews, and you'll see that I'm not alone in this opinion.  I saw another bouncer throwing more people out tonight than I've seen at all the times I've been out at clubs in SF.I suspect it's a scam: the club was filled way past its legally allowed capacity (it's posted on the wall), and I think they throw people out so they can keep their money and pretend that they comply with the fire laws.Hopefully a fire marshall will show up one night, shut this place down, and put these douchebags their out of a job.  It's a shame because the bartenders seemed pretty nice.

$10 to get in for 21+ and $15 for 18-20 yr. olds. I had a great time and the music was AWESOME, Electropop and the bar had good prices on drinks. I paid $8 for a redbull and vodka, mmmm. I'd recommend this place to non-dramatic, fun loving people :)

If you are a business owner in san francisco and are in the nightclub business and run an 18+ venue you're in it for the love of it.  There are so few venues in this city, and anywhere for that matter, that are 18+ that have great security, good music and awesome programming.  If you don't like gay people, if hipsters threaten you because you still shop at westfield, don't come by and post your self-important yelps about how this club sucks.   There's a place for you on union street.

Came here for the blow up, but if i could rename it--it was more like a crappy blow job. I heard about this place from a few friends who had yet to turn 21. We checked it out and it was like being at a hipster kid's house party. I swear, this is far the most i've seen in one place of cross over guy-girls (sometimes its hard to tell ;T )  in skinny nut hugging jeans, make up and faux-hawks. We go in and order drinks. I let one of the minors hold a drink while i get some thing from my purse and next thing you know some security guard flashes his pointer and is like you're not 21 and takes MY DRINk!! and kicks my friend out just like that? WTF YO!! he's 21 in like a month. WACK. So he's kickin it outside, and im like F that i paid a 20 cover. Me and my girl bop to some techno rave scene while observing these could be girls making out with hot girls..ugh weird.  I get another drank my infamous AMF, once again i let my friend hold it for a sec, and out of anowhere i another mother frodo vagina KICKS US BOTH OUT!!! it's a fricking hipster scene, it ain't even 21. I can't believe im saying this but KIDDY NIGHTS IS SOOO MUCH BETTER!! UGH in yo face, BLOW JOB!! Don't go here unless ur a emo hipster.

This was one of the first places I checked out when I moved to SF. Tormenta Tropical was awesome, loved the techno-cumbia and the diverse crowd.Came here again tonight to see Tenderlions & Steve Aoki, and I remembered all the reasons I like this place so much. Cheap drinks (vodka soda in a pint glass for $5), a really cool mix of people, and just a really good vibe. It's not really indie so much as eclectic -- all crowds are represented at Rickshaw Stop. Yes, the ventilation could be better.

I recently visited the Stop and as a venue, I loved it! The overall turnout of events could have went better (thanks Lady Sovereign, you rude cow). Doors were supposed to open at 9pm, but the line was still moving pretty slowly to get in; but major props to the ID checker at the front for trying, constantly screaming for everyone to get their IDs out and ready. Upon entering, you might have to fight through the bathroom queue to get anywhere. Ceilings are pretty low, but don't worry they shouldn't cave in--just keep walking, get your drinks and shake that thang! What I loved about the venue, was wether upstairs, downstairs, bathroom or bar, the ambiance was very home-y, almost an intimate gathering of friends (don't worry, I'm not an emo or a hipster). Drinks were awesome: great Tokyo Iced Tea. AND woot woot for the upstairs smoking room! The openers were fun--they really got the audience going. Then Ms. Diva Sovereign managed to get through four songs before walking off for a second and final time. Needless to say, everyone tried making the best of the situation, but one of the guards did not like it when a friend walked on stage and grabbed the rest of the Diva's crate of beer (Dos XX's but free is free). I understand that the Diva just wasn't feeling it, but come on. So, the jerk of a guard huffed and puffed and through us all out, even though the DJ said everyone could split her beer. Still managed to have an awesome time though. Glad/Proud we got kicked out of a place we no longer wanted to be. So, to reiterate, Yay for Rickshaw and poo on the Lady Sovereign (you should put that in your pipe and smoke it before your next show you sorry twit--oops, might still be a bit angry with her).

cute intimate indie music bar club scene i guess i'd say. loved the red glowiness and few strings of big bulby velvety orange lights, made me feel like a carnival lounge scene from city of lost children (that old great fairytalish french movie).  zee avi was great, but this whole early show business ends too early and walking out into the cold grey light of dusk is kinda a let down after a cool show and big drink. but i'm not whining.

Ew, smelled like all bars with wooden floors smell like.  Like theres been so much alcohol spilled on the floor, its been absorbing it for years...It just STINKS. the place was not too big, but there was an upstairs.  People were WAY too intimate with me, like move over! and if youre in the front row, can you please sit down, or at least not be 6ft. tall? GOD.
Saw Zee Avi here yesterday evening and had a wonderful time!Reasonable priced drinks, good atmosphere and again, Zee Avi was performing. :)

Went there with a friend for pop fest. Quite 'indie' crowd, but no one tried to start a fight, there was plenty of space, and tons of dancing.It's a small intimate venue and the bands were GREAT. suburban kids with biblical names, and three others. Stuff I never would've heard otherwise, but I absolutely LOVED.I'll definitely be back.

Fun venue, great acoustics, friendly staff, generous pours, first rate bookings.  Recently saw Kimya Dawson's performance here.  But I guess it would be more fair to say "Perspired through Kimya Dawson's..."  Sheesh, it was so hot!  And zero ventilation. It admittedly was one of those record-breaking-temperature April days, but even still -- they need to install some fans at a minimum.  Better, a full A/C system.  Or at least a window at the back to generate a cross-breeze.  I'd love to attend the non-stop Bhangra nights, but the descriptions of heat and sweat are a real turn-off.  Okay, I'll admit I'm a baby... but I do have the not-unusual need for oxygen... breathing has become somewhat of a habit with me... though I'm trying to quit!

Went here only once, to see Hollywood Holt perform, presented by 24karatmilkcrate productions... their first production.  Great show and I think  Rickshaw Stop was an excellent venue.  Got an adequate stage and a pretty good sound system. This night the ventilation worked well for a crowd of just over 150.  They can comfortably fit more.   I liked the upstairs arrangment but I think on a crowded night there would be a need for more seating.  The bar was reasonable and water was available too. you know how hot it can get with a thriving crowd.  Anyway, if 24karatemilkcrate puts on another show here, I'd be sure to go.

whats up you crazy scenesters you. ya'll make me laaauuggh. ya'll so cool. you know it. hahaha!anyway. this place is fun. nice size, but that makes it kinda crowded. but what sweet clubbish locale isnt crowded eh? cool music. indie rock. electro. house. breakbeats, hrm  or maybe i just WANT them to play breakbeats? whatev.top floor has a chill seating area and a smokers room which is obviously filled with METRIC TONS of smoke. cough much? now you do.i have only been a few times and I gotta say I have had a good time. there is a small stage at the front of the place and it is damn fun to Rage and "get down" on said stage. recently i have not enjoyed the folks that attend. i have had to throw some elbows at dumb asses texting and drunkenly falling on me and the GF. cool DJs. sweet music.and le caslte vania has performed there.THATS A GOOD THING HE IS BADASS.rage onoh you scenesters, just stop, really, my side is spltting.haaahhhoh uh its like 15 bucks to get in? 10-2 AM ish? its fun.lots of fun.

I had a blast here last night, however this was not due to the bar. Had it not been for the performers and company I had with me, this joint would leave me in a haze.. literallyHAZE.. due in part to the "smoking room" upstairs.. really? Having a smoking section in a bar is like having a peeing section in a pool...  The rest of the haze was due to some mysterious fog machine they have. At one point my friend says to me, is my vision going bad or is it getting really hazy in here.. No, you are not going blind.. The joint could use ventilation.. The area in front of the stage is very open, and high ceilings, and despite this you still feel like ur in a sweaty basement. Good show... not so good venue... Bonus points for the crazy rickshaw bike upstairs.

I have never been treated so unjustifiably poorly by the staff of any establishment in my life. The behavior of the employees here Saturday night was honestly shocking and really took me aback.Let me preface this by saying I was not that drunk. I know that sounds like the "drunk girl's motto" but I was very clear headed when dealing with the staff. Now, I had been dancing in the middle of the club with a friend, who, to put it simply, dropped me and I fell hard in front of everyone. I mean hard. Super embarrassing and probably made me look a lot drunker than I actually was. After my moment in the spotlight, I scurried away to the bar to avoid the stares, and that's when the fun started. I went to get my 2nd drink of the night (the first of which I shared with my friend), and essentially got cut off. He probably saw my fall. He didn't even say this, or anything for that matter, and when I asked for a drink he basically scoffed and said "don't think that's happening," turned his back, and ignored me. I didn't understand what was going on.But whatever, it wasn't that big of deal and I didn't make a fuss. When I came back later in the night to close my tab (for the 1 drink I had bought), I asked him if he really thought I had been that drunk, to which he responded, "yeah, drunk or on roofies, something is going on." Who says that? It was the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard, and he was clearly just trying to be insulting. When I asked him what his name was, I again got the silent treatment, and he went in the back room. The other bartender was also ignoring me and nobody would give any names. Maybe they knew I'd write a bad review? If you're going to treat somebody like shit, man up and give them your name.The place was closing down, and having been there with the band, I was waiting on the stairs for them to get the car and load up. You know the face that women make, and that tone of voice, where someone is pretending to say something nicely but really they are trying to be really mean? Kind of a like a little tilt of the head/smirk/raised eyebrows look? This little asian chick employee comes over to me (I'm donig absolutely nothing) and tells me I need to leave in the rudest way, with that face. I told her I was with the band and that I was just waiting for them, and she essentially said, again in a really venomous way, that she didn't care who I was with, I needed to get out. To which I replied, "fine but you don't have to be such a bitch about it." Yes yes, I know I should've just held my tongue, and I am generally quite tame, but it was the culmination of the entire staff marking me and treating me like !@#$ for the duration of the night that did it. Of course she, and the 3 other employees at the bar immediately start screaming at me, 'YOU need to get the !@#$ out of this club NOW!" Which, at that point, was warranted.And here is how you know it wasn't just me. The guys were loading up the van in front of the club, at 2:25 or so, and one of the angry bartenders (who was leaving to go home, not knowing that I was in the car), yells at one of the band members for parking in front of the club and having all of their shit around. He tells him to have some respect. HE'S PACKING UP! He just finished a show! It was crazy.It's unfortunate that the staff (at least, I guess, on a saturday) is so horrendously rude because otherwise the space as a music venue is not bad at all.

The Rickshaw is a pretty cool place for live music and dancing. Upstairs is a mezzanine with chairs, benches, and couches, in case you don't want to be down on the dance floor and just want to chill back.Downstairs is a low level stage so you're not being towered over by the band(s) and have easy access to jump on stage and dance, if thats what you're into. The atmosphere is super fun and upbeat, and usually have some really good bands performing. They have a small bar, but serves just about everything. They have killer deals on drinks: $5 for a pint of redbull and vodka? YES PLEASE!Sometimes I think the cover charge is outlandish for certain nights and no name bands, but if you're willing to pay the price, you can still have a good time.

I went here last night to see the Limousines---awesome band with that song on the radio called "We are very busy people." Also saw the New Trust, and Har Mar---very very funny and talented groups.Ambience is super fun. Good beer on tap.They have Absolut Ruby Red.Crowd was pretty good.Parking nearby.Upstairs seating is great if the dancefloor is packed.Has a similar vibe to the Casbah in San Diego---which is a place I miss, so ya, I dig the Rickshaw---OH! and duh, they have cute rickshaws and bicycley paraphernalia you can sit on/in!!

Pretentious much?Get over yourselves boys and girls. Blow-Up SUCKS. Asshole bouncers, asshole staff, and photographers that seem to be everywhere. Not to mention it is expensive as FUCK.The last time I went here must have been about a year ago. My friend and I (we were both under 21 at the time) got kicked out because we had used the restroom and washed our hands. The place didn't have any paper towels(of course) so we were drying our hands off on our pants. A bouncer walked by and kicked us out because he said we were trying to get the "X" marks off of our hands so that we could drink, although they were still very visible because that is not at all what we were doing. We tried to explain ourselves but he was on a power trip and began yelling at us in front of the line. Keep in mind that we were not even drunk. My friend had checked his bag and coat in at coat check so he asked if he could go in to get his shit so we could leave. NO. We proceeded to ask a staff member to go and get his things out of coat check since we were not allowed back in. NO. We had to call someone we knew from inside to come out, get the ticket, and retrieve the belongings. This place is not worth your time and money.

How could you turn down a crowd that gets their sweat on so profusely that as they turn, after the stage is completely taken over, the sweat flies off of them? I know I can't. It's right up my alley.Some of the crew and I rolled out deep for Non Stop Bhangra night at Rickshaw stop. Walking in, we were a few early, which was just fine. We got our drinks, posted up in the corner and put on our dancing shoes, ready to be taught some of the elegantly simple and artfully infused dance moves that are, well, Bhangra. I had never heard of it before, although I had seen that style many times in Paris. Nights flew by listening to raj music while in underground clubs by the Louvre as the locals went mad. The people that frequent the small club with an upstairs are die hards. It was incredible to see the different flavors of people jam packed in there literally letting it all go and getting their groove on. I sweated through my clothing, and for once, wished I had worn kicks instead of heels so that I could have really gotten down and dirty in it. No drama, no problems, just a ton of people all there with a common thread, they love to dance. The beat inspires them. What could be more perfect than that? I didn't get skeevy men dripping on my ass for once, no one attempting to take the two of us home that night. It was refreshing. Just make sure you're not claustrophobic, as it's as tightly packed in there late at night as sardines in a can. Oh, and wear something you don't have to dryclean, cause as a forewarning, you're gonna get drenched. If it's not from your own sweat, from those around you.
i'll be back.

Rickshaw Stop is a great venue. The event I am reviewing is Non-Stop Bhangra. What a great idea--good music, happy people, but.....(record scratches, music stops) I came here to dance. Isn't that what Non-Stop Bhangra is all about? The problem is that they pack you in there so tightly that you can't move or breathe for that matter, as the place can't hold enough oxygen for so many people. It is a popular event so have it twice a month so people can actually do what they came to do--DANCE!! Don't be a greedy club owner!! Luckily the Fire Marshall didn't get wind of this mess. I won't be going back. Too bad. But I love the Bhangra so I'll be planning to host an event like this somewhere else, where the profits don't trump fun.

I had gotten mixed reviews of this place before I went here so I was nt sure what to expect of the Bhangra night I was here for. Minus .5 stars for the $20 cover charge - Thats effin pricey!Plus 1 star for the music which was pretty awesome. Rocked my socks, YEEEEEEAAAH!!!Minus 1.5 for the cramped and stuffy experience. The place is Oh-mi-god super stuffed. Its tough to groove without getting stepped on. I thought I was excellent at manouvering and not getting stepped over but in the end I nearly fell on my face. And I was'nt even buzzing yet. LOLMinus 1 for the gin and tonic the bartender made. My honey fell sick after downing that despicable concoction.Its gonna take a lot of convincing for me to go back.

I like Rickshaw Stop on nights when it's not dancetronic 90s club kid wanna be paradise.Granted, those nights are far and few in between.  Though I have been to this club when it's been less than packed and had a really good time.  I've also seen a band play here and liked the venue for that.I think that I am just too old to really get into the whole smooshed together with sweaty underaged boys wearing no shirts and Oakland A's hats groovin' out with glowsticks and spilling Red Bull and vodka on my brand new shoes.Dude, what's happened to me?  Pretty soon I'm going to be yelling at kids to get off my fucking lawn.  Ugh, color me old.

the music, staff, and dancefloor is so awesome and the drinks are not expensive one bit but i just couldn't stand some folks that were there. weeeelll, i can't entirely blame the club for the patrons that attend. i don't know if it's like this every night - i really hope not - but there were kids rolling hella hard and hella drunk and they had those x's on their hands. but that's not the problem because i was under 21 once. but some of these kids were down right rude. and honestly it's a bit of a scene. but i guess these days, everything is a scene. but the fact that gil mantera's party dream was there and fucking rocked it, this place gets 3 stars.
I've only been here for cockblock.... which effin' rules!The dancefloor can get really hot and crowded, but the upstairs allows for a quick getaway if you're feelin' overheated.

This is a dope little place to watch some live music.  Sound board guy is on his game.  I was there on a thurs, so not that packed. We were able to get drunk with no waiting, listen to some good bands and watch drunk girls try to get free drinks.  Recommend it.

This place can be a hit or miss depending on the music that night, but if you pay attention to the calendar and plan ahead, you'll have a great time.  Great place to go to grab a few drinks and enjoy some good music.  Beware of Friday nights if you don't like partying with a bunch of kids since it's 18+ those nights.  I randomly went there on a Friday night not knowing what to expect, and I felt like I was at a high school party.  The staff is great and friendly, especially the bartenders ;)  Just don't act like a dumb ass and you'll earn their respect, same as any bar you go.  There's also a foosball table upstairs!  Upstairs is a great place to lounge and enjoy the music.  you can sit on one of the many couches they have up there or chill by the balcony and watch the band play.  There's even an actual rickshaw upstairs that you can sit on (as long as you're not a fatty fat fatass).

Note: This review is more a review of a particular club night, maybe not on the establishment itself. In my experience the people that work at the Rickshaw Stop are great people, it just seems like its something about the Blow Up promoters that get under my skin and here is why: It was pretty dead earlier in the night but soon the trying-to-hard-hipsters started to make their way in. The DJ was moderately good the entire night but much to arrogant. Its hilarious watching these young girls hang on to these guys like rockstars. They didn't like the fact that I went up to them and asked them to play a song. Okay DJ's maybe you don't have to play it, maybe you don't want to play it, but don't be an ass a simple "I'll try to get it in there" would be awesome. Don't be a pretentious fuck just because I'm not a coked out whore asking to blow you.The more packed it got the more the temperature started to rise. It becomes unbearable by midnight. I was with a group of friends but I instantly noticed how people here are not as friendly as I have encountered at other places.It also took way to long to get a drink at the bar which surprised me because on other nights I would be served rather quickly.So, on Blow Up nights, the standard for this place is lowered. It becomes much to chaotic and the people who run it don't seem to care about the patrons. However, the crowd doesn't seem to care how they are treated for the most part either. The young kids, some probably with fake id's, are much more concerned with getting their picture taken making out with a stranger or with their left nipple hanging out.Maybe I am just much to old for this?I def want to attend a Cockblock or other gay/lez night and hopefully make up for the experience on this night.
I didn't really enjoys it.  Alot of people, maybe on differeant day.  My friend used to work, so I could get in free.  It is my mothers liquor store.

Lets set the scene for this event.... Its New years eve and my FAVORITE band... Shiny Toy Guns.. is performing at Rickshaw Stop along with DJ Low B.We got to rickshaw around 11. We had pre paid for tickets and stood in line for just a few minutes. We walked in and could feel the excitement. The actual venue is not Schick or sophisticated. Its simplistic, retro, and very functional. You walk and see  a bar on your right. On the left stair stairs lead up to another bar and more seating. We quickly and easily got our drinks from the 1st floor bar. From that point we walked straight into a huge open room. One end was the stage. We made our way to the side of the room and were able to score a low table to put our drinks and jackets on (and later stand and dance on).The band rocked. Everyone was in a great mood. No one was worried about appearances or glam. Everyone here was mellow. I SSSOOO appreciated being able to go out in just a t shirt (a fancy one) jeans and chucks. We danced and jumped all around all night.Bottom line. Fair drink prices. Friendly Staff. No dress code. PRICELESS!!!

*This review is for Friday Nights and Blow Up*18nUP? It's been years, and I mean YEARS since I've been to such an event but I sucked it up for a friend's birthday. I was plesantly surprized because I ended up having a good time. The whole place reminded me of High School! Not in a bad way, and no, not because I was a couple of years older than the majority of the folks there but because of the setup and decor. The venue set-up reminded me of a HS auditorium because it's a widely spacious dance floor that faces a stage. There's also an upstairs bar + balcony with vintage decorations like old school bikes and 80s looking tables. The crowd was dressed uber trendy. For some reason I noticed a lot of boys in fashionable hats. A good handful of girlies were wearing party or cocktail dresses. Their best threads for the friday night school dance. I keed, they all looked cute, I swear!Electric music. Heard some Kanye, 80s, brit pop, and other uppity beats while I was there. I love dancing to it! Anything goes, and ANYONE can dance to it. Folks were wyling out and letting themselves go to the beats. Good for them for enjoying themselves! Drinks weren't bad: $3 for beer and $6 for wine. Contrary to other reviews, the bartenders aren't jerks either. Don't think I'd come back by choice but Rickshaw is okay in my book.

I've only gone here for Blow Up which is held like 3 Fridays of the month.Check it out here: http://blowupsf.com/I am just going to say that this is one of my favorite places to get drunk and go nuts.If you don't like Top 40 or any other crap they play on the radio come here and listen to some good funk, electropop, foreign, and electronica.I promise you'll have fun here as long as you're cool with being around lots of hipster people and not that many Asian people.The drinks are priced well.The number one thing is the music. It's so worth it just to listen to the dope DJ's spin some sick songs you've never heard.The only reason I don't give this place 5-stars is because it's an 18+ place. If it were 21+ then it would be perfect.
Eh.  Get on the guest list somehow, because it's not worth the line otherwise.  Sweaty, good music, lots of underage kids, asshole bartenders, large space.  Good to go to like once every 2 months.

Went for Halloween 08, didn't even get in because I didn't buy a pre-ticket- totally my fault. 2nd time I went with a small group of three and only had to wait 30ish mins to get in (this was considered awesome since the last time I couldn't even hear any music I was so stuck in line)Not a fabulous venue but for $15 I'll take it. No pictures, not even the ones they take of themselves will do Rickshaw justice. The lighting and visual was fantastic but I don't recommend getting too shit faced unless you wanna give the people waiting in line a good show (on stupidity). Been to a few clubs now, and have been to neko to go on stage but this time some stranger just pulled me up and I had a blast. AMAZING in comparison to Club X. Like my friend explained, trashy people go where trashy people are, regardless of the club. Blow up is lucky to have down to earth cool people. Had NO problem whatsoever about the space issue, I like that so it works for me. Guys were tasteful and I was never surprised with a random bulge humping my backside like Club X.DEFF going back. deff.

I've gone to the Rickshaw Stop a few times now, on both "quieter" nights and nights like Blow Up. The place is rather drab looking when the seizure lights aren't all over the place, the bar is nice, and I quite adore the smoking room. Blow Up is always crazy packed and if you haven't seen the collections at American Apparel, then come here. $15 for 18+ and $10 for 21+. The music is pretty good, really crammed, and sweaty. I've started to really like going out dancing and this is place is reliably fun with the right group of friends.

Venue shmenue.It's really about the act.  I've been here for Nonstop Bhangra, and I've seen a couple of bands perform.  Dengue Fever?  Good stuff.  They created a festive atmosphere with balloons and streamers.Other times?  The venue just sits on its own, like an Ikea dining table in an ugly apartment.

I've only been here for Blow Up to dance to electro/indie music so barring that detail, I'm still a fan. $15 cover charge for 18+, $10 for 21+. I gotta get my dirtying dancing on sometime, but since there ain't no Havana Nights to speak of, Rickshaw does just fine.The crowd is pretty mixed here, but I always have a good time. It's always about the crowd of people you bring with you though. Just dance like no one's watching (save the photographers and video recording). They play some pretty sick mixes here so I've been here again and again.It would be accurate to say that this is a hipster hotspot on Blow Up nights, but it's not like you're out of place because I'm mos def not a hipster. BLOW UP AND GET DOWN!

Love this place!  Met the owners and found out they love to support the local artist/music scene.  They were able to squeeze our 2 hour film screening party on a Saturday- which is very hard to do.  My top reasons why you should go there:1. Bartenders are quick and slick.2. They offer my favorite pear cider there. 3. If you love live music- this is the place to go.4. The people are mixed, hip, and good-looking5. If you are short, and cannot make it to the front, there is an upstairs floor where you can lounge on sofas and watch the show.6. Always seem to have a blast when I am there!Say hi to Billy the bartender when you get drinks.  Tip him good....

A fun place to hang out. The crowd changes along with what's going on and who's playing that night...it's not always teeny boppers, though that happens sometimes. Check out bands here before they make it big, as they tend to book them just before they make it big. MIA...Lesly and the Ly's...Cody Breaker. The foosball table rocks, they have one of the few indoor smoking rooms in San Francisco (I don't even smoke anymore, but think it's nice to let the poor smokers be inside, all warm and cozy  for a change) and the bartenders are always friendly.
